You can create an VolumeProfile indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the VolumeProfile constructor.

VolumeProfile()1/2

            VolumeProfile QuantConnect.Indicators.VolumeProfile (
     *int  period,
   )

Creates a new VolumeProfile indicator with the specified period.

Parameters
*int period The period of this indicator.

Return

VolumeProfile - The new VolumeProfile indicator object.

Creates a new VolumeProfile indicator with the specified name, period and priceRangeRoundOff.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.
int period The period of this indicator.
*decimal priceRangeRoundOff (Optional) /. Default: 0.05m

Return

VolumeProfile - The new VolumeProfile indicator object.

Definition at line 41 of file Indicators/VolumeProfile.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

private VolumeProfile _vp;

// In Initialize()
_vp = new VolumeProfile(name, period);
_vp.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _vp, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_vp.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _vp.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.vp = VolumeProfile(name, period)
self.vp.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.vp, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.vp.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.vp.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

private VolumeProfile _vp;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_vp = new VolumeProfile(name, period);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.Bars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _vp.Update(data.Bars[symbol]);
}
if (_vp.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _vp.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.vp = VolumeProfile(name, period)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.Bars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.vp.Update(data.Bars[self.symbol])
if self.vp.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.vp.Current.Value
